nodes.bodyText: Let's add javadoc for all of these new classes.
Why did we do this swap?  Was the error hard to follow?
I wonder if we can do something stronger here.  I wonder if we can parse the expression with FIQL/RSQL parser.  A regex is not expressive enough to capture all the legal values.

This comment doesn't capture the breadth of what the user can define.  The semi-colon can also be a comma.  Each operator has its own rules.
I think a pointer to the RSQL documentation might be better than trying to redefine here.

This might have been too simplistic.  Check out:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5205339/regular-expression-matching-fully-qualified-class-names
Something simple here might be better:  "[%s] is not a valid Java class name."

Neither of them is also an option.
I would reword: "tableSource and values cannot both be defined for a dimension.  Choose one or none."
Why do we define toString here but nowhere else?
this one extends AbstractKeywordValidator which has abstract toString method. Others extends AbstractFormatAttribute which doesn't have toString method.
Do we need to validate that we have an object node here?  Do we need to check for fields that are not tableSource or values?
Constructor verifies the type of node.
You can provide a URL fragment (https://something.com#fragment) to link to a section in the documentation.
